properties.name: Ben Hill Griffin Stadium - Gainesville FL
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Saw the Tigers beat the Gators here in 2007.

properties.name: Bryant Denny Stadium - Tuscaloosa AL
properties.description: Posted by Billjay I was here for the 2002 & 2008 Iron Bowls.

properties.name: Carrier Dome - Syracuse NY
properties.description: Posted by Billjay I\'ve seen numerous football & basketball games here. And yes, despite the fact that Carrier has the naming rights, the Dome is not air conditioned & it gets hot during a football game. Last time I visited was for the Auburn - Syracuse game in 2001 (the 1st post-9/11 game for both schools). There were small American flags on every seat, the NY governor was there along with submachine gun toting state troopers.

properties.name: Commonwealth Stadium - Lexington KY
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Went here for the Auburn game in 2005.

properties.name: Davis Wade Stadium - Starkville MS
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Saw the Auburn @ Mississippi St game in 2008 w/ my buddy Mike.

properties.name: Fulton County Stadium - Atlanta GA
properties.description: Posted by Billjay And there once was a place called Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium. And there were Peach Bowls played there. And I went to one...

properties.name: Garrett Stadium - Phenix City AL
properties.description: Posted by Billjay I saw the Div 3 Championship game (aka the Stagg Bowl) here (?) in 1988. Ithaca defeated Central. The reason I\'ve included a question mark is that I sure don\'t remember the game being played at a high school field. Then again, I could\'ve sworn that I saw the game in Columbus & it took a trip to the microfilm department of the library to convince me that on Dec 10, 1988, the Stagg Bowl was played in Garrett Stadium in Phenix City, Alabama.

properties.name: Georgia Dome - Atlanta GA
properties.description: Posted by Billjay I\'ve been here both for an SEC Championship & a Chick-Fil-A Bowl.

properties.name: Jordan Hare Stadium - Auburn, AL
properties.description: Posted by Billjay My 1st game here was in 1993. It was also Terry Bowden\'s 1st game as head coach - a 16-14 victory over Ole Miss.

properties.name: L.A. Coliseum - Los Angeles, CA
properties.description: Posted by Billjay We went here for the Auburn @ U.S.C. game in 2002. Great stadium, wonderful kettle corn, tepid fan support - note the temporary bleachers & the banners covering up the permanent seats. Despite a large contigent of AU fans the Tigers ended up losing by a touchdown. Oh well - at least we went to Disneyland (our neighbor, an AU Plainsman at the time, had an even better trip - he won about 0K on The Price Is Right).

properties.name: Liberty Bowl Memorial Stadium - Memphis TN
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Saw the 2000 (?) Liberty Bowl between Louisville & Colorado State. Miserable day, miserable game...

properties.name: Neyland Stadium - Knoxville, TN
properties.description: Posted by Billjay , , TNAuburn @ UTenn in 2009. 102,000 plus in attendance.

properties.name: Papa Johns Cardinal Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Been here once to see Syracuse lose to U. of L. At least I got to meet Otto....

properties.name: Raymond James Stadium - Tampa FL
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Saw the Outback Bowl on New Year\'s Day, 2010. Northwestern vs Auburn. 78 pass attempts by he NW QB. Three "we win!!" field rushes by the AU players. Luckily, the last one counted: AU 38 - NW 35, in OT.

properties.name: Sanford Stadium - Athens GA
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Fun fact: Auburn will lose @ UGA if I am in attendance (2003, 2007). So I guess I\'m never going back....

properties.name: Superdome - New Orleans LA
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Sugar Bowl between Syracuse & Auburn - the Tie-Dye game...

properties.name: Tampa Stadium - Tampa FL
properties.description: Posted by Billjay I saw the 1989 Hall of Fame Bowl game here (Syracuse vs LSU); in 1999 the stadium was demolished & converted into a parking lot for the new Raymond James Stadium.

properties.name: Vanderbilt Stadium - Nashville TN
properties.description: Posted by Billjay Saw the Auburn Tigers lose to the \'dores in 2008.
